item.title: About
item.description: About Me I received B.S. degree from Anhui University in 2009. Then, I studied the statistical physics as applied to complex networks and complex systems at University of Science and Technology of China, and received Ph.D. degree in 2014. From 2014 to 2016, I was a Post-doctoral Fellower in the Department of Modern Physics at University of Science and Technology of China. In the first half of 2016, I worked at Department of Applied Physics, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University as a Post-doctoral Fellower.

item.title: News
item.description: News 2024-09-20 We systematically studied explosive percolation in finite dimensions, and the paper has been pulished in Physics Review Research. 2024-09-20 We proposed a new percolation model, called iterative percolation, which has rich and interesting critical behaviors. The main findings can be found in Physics Review Research. 2024-07-17 Congratulation! Liwenying Yang’s first paper on explosive percolation has just been published in Physics Review E. 2024-05-29 We propose an algorithm for identifying important nodes of complex networks based on percolation process, see Advances in Complex Systems for details.

item.title: Research
item.description: Percolation Percolation originally means that “to filter” or “trickle through”. Here, in statistical physics, it often refers to a simple model and the corresponding profound theoretical system, which touches many concepts of statistical physics and nonlinear physics, such as scaling, renormalization, phase transition, critical phenomena and fractal. Due to the complexity involved in obtaining exact results from analytical models of percolation, computer simulations are typically used. So computational methods is also involved in the study of percolation model.
